string.text: Full metal jacket .40 S&W (10x22mm) rounds. The .40 S&W round has been popular with law enforcement agencies in the United States, Canada, and Australia. While possessing nearly identical accuracy, drift and drop it is much more powerful than the 9x19 round and with more manageable recoil than the 10mm Auto.

Jacketed Hollow point .40 S&W (10x22mm) rounds. The bullet fragments on impact with soft tissue maximizing tissue damage, blood loss and shock. The .40 S&W round has been popular with law enforcement agencies in the United States, Canada, and Australia. While possessing nearly identical accuracy, drift and drop it is much more powerful than the 9x19 round and with more manageable recoil than the 10mm Auto.

The .50 Action Express (12.7x33mm) is a large caliber handgun round. It was developed in 1988 by Evan Whildin of Action Arms. It is one of the most powerful pistol rounds in production. It's primary uses are silhouette shooting and medium/big game hunting.
Jacketed hollow point .50 Action Express (12.7x33mm) rounds. The bullet framents on impact causing heavy damage to soft tissue.
Armor piercing .50 Action Express (12.7x33mm) rounds. Big mean plate eatin' beans.

The 6.8 Remington Special Purpose round is a rifle round that was developed by Remington Arms in collaboration with members of the U.S. Army to possibly replace the 5.56 NATO round. It is midway between the 5.56x45mm NATO and 7.62x51mm NATO in diameter and muzzle energy, slightly more powerful than the 7.62x39 round.
Short for "Super Shock Tip" the SST round is designed to deliver tremendous shock on impact while expanding quickly and reliably.
6.8x43 armor piercing round designed for optimal body armor penetration.
Jacketed flat point .50 Beowulf (12.7x42) rounds. The bullet expands on impact, crushing through body armor and causing tremendous tissue damage.
Hollow point .50 Beowulf (12.7x42) rounds. The bullet framents on impact causing tremendous damage to soft tissue.
Armor piercing .50 Beowulf (12.7x42) rounds. Designed to kick through the plating of armored light vehicles.

The AK-15 is a variant of the AK-12 chambered in 7.62x39, allowing for the use of standard AK-47 and AKM magazines. Like the base AK-12, the rifle comes standard with Picatinny rails, an adjustable telescoping stock and the rear sight has been moved to the back of the receiver. The rifle has a new muzzle brake and improved rifling, making it more accurate than other AK-47 variants. Its main drawbacks are the higher recoil and heavier weight compared to its 5.45x39 cousin.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] TGP-A suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, Barska ES AC10632, EOTech scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] GP-25 grenade launcher

The AR-15 is a 5.56x45 semi-automatic version of the M4 assault rifle marketed to civilians. Can mount a suppressor and optics, but not a grenade launcher.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] NATO suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, Barska ES AC10632, EOTech scopes

The Beretta 96 pistol is a variant of the popular 9x19mm Beretta 92 pistol, chambered in .40 S&W. It features the same large magazine capacity and performs similar to its 9mm cousin, making it a popular sidearm among stalkers.\n %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: \n
%c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Gemtech suppressor

The CZ-75 was developed in the Czech Republic by the Koucky brothers. This semi-automatic pistol first appeared in 1975, entered production in 1976 and was intended for the export market. The CZ-75 accumulated the best features from many preceding designs and the resulting pistol was aesthetically attractive, comfortable to handle, shoot, accurate and reliable in operation. Made by CZ arms in various versions and modifications, the CZ-75 was also widely copied and cloned.
 This variant of the CZ 75 is chambered in .40S&W, and features an increased in stopping power and lighter weight, but its main drawbacks are an increase in recoil, and lower magazine capacity.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 

%c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Gemtech suppressor

The ultimate hand cannon - bulky, heavy and highly lethal. Developed as a specialized weapon for hunting medium-sized and large game, as well as for shooting competitions involving firing at steel body targets at distances over 50 meters. Its limited use in the Zone can be attributed to its price, size and weight, which are all double those of other pistols. This particular model is chambered for the hefty .50 AE Magnum round.

The Glock 21 is the .45 ACP variant of the Glock pistol series, featuring the same magazine capacity as the Glock 19 but higher damage output.\n %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: \n
%c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Gemtech suppressor

The Glock 35 is the .40 S&W model of the Glock pistol series first introduced in 1990, beginning with the Glock 22. It features a slighty lower capacity compared to the Glock 19, but improves upon the accuracy and fire rate.\n %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: \n
%c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Gemtech suppressor

The FN FNP pistol is a series of semi-automatic, polymer framed pistols manufactured in Columbia, South Carolina by FNH USA, a division of Fabrique Nationale de Herstal. Debuted in early 2006, the FNP series weapons are hammer fired weapons utilizing a Browning cam system with an external extractor. The trigger module is housed inside the polymer frame as an individual unit connected to the hammer. The magazine release button is held in place by a retention pin which can be removed to allow the button to be reversed.
 The FN FNP-40 pistol is a variant of the FNP-45 chambered in .40 S&W. It is notablly more accurate but features a lower damage output compared to its .45 variant.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 

%c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Gemtech suppressor

A variant of the 5.56x45mm LR-300 assault rifle chambered for the larger 6.8mm SPC round. Due to its larger round, its fire rate is noticeably lower compared to the standard LR-300, but features a higher damage output.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] 6.8 Suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, Barska ES AC10632, EOTech scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] M203 grenade launcher

The Bushmaster M4 is a copy of the popular M4 carbine manufactured by Bushmaster Firearms International, modeled on the AR-15 platform and chambered in 6.8 SPC.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] 6.8 Suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, Barska ES AC10632, EOTech scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] M203 grenade launcher

Based on the M16 rifle, this weapon fires the more powerful 6.8x43 SPC round and fires in semi-automatic and full automatic firemodes, boosting higher firepower then its 5.56x45mm variant but higher recoil due to its larger round.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] 6.8 Suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, Barska ES AC10632, EOTech scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] M203 grenade launcher (after modification)

The Beowulf M4 is a fully automatic variant of the M4 carbine chambered in .50 Beowulf. The round is intended to improve stopping power greatly at short- to medium-range as compared to the standard 5.56x45mm NATO round. One of its advertised uses is at vehicle checkpoints, since the heavy bullet's flight path is not easily deflected by auto glass or standard vehicle body panels. Although much has been written about its tactical uses, the .50 Beowulf is gaining recognition as a sporting cartridge. It is becoming more widely recognized as being usable by stalkers for hunting against the Zone's creatures. 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] .50 Suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, Barska ES AC10632, EOTech scopes
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] M203 grenade launcher (after modification)

The M68 is a customized M249 machine gun rechambered in 6.8 SPC.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] 6.8 Suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, Barska ES AC10632, EOTech scopes

The UMP was developed by H&K in the 1990s, first appearing on the market in 1999. The idea behind the UMP was to create lightweight and powerful submachine gun, that was also cheaper than the MP5. The UMP, being targeted primarily for US law enforcement, appeared in .45ACP and .40SW chamberings, and later in 9mm. Providing greater stopping power than the MP5, the UMP45 also produces more recoil. This makes controlling full automatic fire more difficult. The UMP45's cyclic rate of fire was lowered significantly to combat this problem.
 The UMP-40 is a variant chambered in .40 S&W, with less weight and higher magazine capacity but doing less damage than its predecessor due to its smaller round.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 

%c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Gemtech suppressor
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ACOG, Barska ES AC10632, EOTech scopes

Originally designed for the American market, the USP, Universal Self loading Pistol, is known as an accurate and reliable handgun. U.S. law enforcement and military provided much of the design criteria for the USP. The controls are uniquely American, influenced by famous designs like the Government Model 1911 pistol. All USPs use a fibre-reinforced polymer frame stiffened by stainless steel inserts at areas subject to stress and friction. Incorporating several successful handgun design elements, the USP Compact .45 is a part of the USP family of handguns designed by H&K. Able to withstand extreme punishment and adverse conditions, it is used by several countries' police and special forces units.
 Developed around the same time as its .45 variant, the USP-40 is chambered .40 S&W rounds. Compared to its .45 ACP and 10mm Auto cousins, it features considerably lower recoil and lighter weight. Its drawbacks include its still considerable size, and lower damage output.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 

%c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Gemtech suppressor

Ergonomics being a key focus in its design, the Walther P99 is a recoil-operated pistol with a fibreglass polymer frame. Developed for law enforcement and the civilian shooting market, it's employed by police units in a number of countries.
 This is a variant chambered for the .40S&W round, featuring lower recoil and slighty lower weight.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 

%c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Gemtech suppressor
